**Eligibility to Work** 




 You will need to provide proof of right to work. It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have the permission to work in the country for the role for which you are applying for.
 



**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 An equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, colour, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnic or national origin, disability, age pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, or any other protected characteristic prohibited by law.
 



 Please be aware, Sherwin-Williams recruiting team members will never request a candidate to provide a payment, ask for financial information, or sensitive personal information like national identification numbers, date of birth, or bank account numbers during the application process.

title: Automation Platform Lead (Whitebox Networking / SONiC)
description:
About the Role
  
CHNEUR AB is building a next-generation fully automated whitebox switch platform for data centers, AI clusters, and enterprise fabrics.
  
We are looking for a senior Automation Platform Lead who will architect and implement our end-to-end automation stack — including ZTP, gNMI/gRPC pipelines, telemetry engines, configuration orchestration, and large-scale distributed automation services.
  
You will work directly with the founder to design and develop our core automation system that integrates SONiC, whitebox hardware (Edgecore, Quanta, Asterfusion), and high-performance network automation workflows.
  
This is a high-impact, product-building role for someone who wants to shape the automation platform from the ground up.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
1. Automation Platform Architecture
  
Design the architecture of a large-scale automation system for whitebox/SONiC switches.
  
Build components for ZTP, configuration pipelines, topology orchestration, state management, and distributed task execution.
  
  

2. Backend & Core System Development
  
Develop high-performance backend modules using C++ / Node.js / Linux system programming.
  
Build agents, controllers, schedulers, and automation engines capable of managing large switch fleets.
  
  

3. Integration with Networking Technologies
  
Implement automation logic for BGP/EVPN, Fabric deployment, RoCE, telemetry, QoS, and switch configuration flows.
  
Work with SONiC APIs, SAI, gNMI, and vendor SDKs.
  
  

4. Distributed System & Observability Development
  
Build robust telemetry pipelines (Prometheus, exporters, event collectors).
  
Ensure scalability, concurrency, and reliability across automation services.
  
  

5. Collaboration and Technical Leadership
  
Work closely with networking experts to convert designs into automation workflows.
  
Provide technical guidance and help establish coding standards and automation frameworks.
  
  

**Required Skills & Experience:**  

Core Technical Background (MUST)
  
10+ years building distributed backend systems or high-performance automation platforms.
  
  

Strong expertise in C++, Node.js, Linux internals, multi-threading, concurrency, performance optimization.
  
  

Experience designing large-scale orchestration, agent frameworks, or automation platforms.
  
  

Deep understanding of system-level programming (epoll, async IO, network sockets, IPC).
  
  

Proven experience integrating multi-language systems (C++ + JS/Node + Python/Go).
  
  

Networking & Automation Knowledge(Preferable / or willing to learn)
  
Experience with gRPC / gNMI / protobuf.
  
Understanding of whitebox switches, SONiC, or network automation concepts (Ansible, ZTP, CI/CD).
  
Familiarity with BGP/EVPN/L3 Fabric concepts is a plus (training provided).
  
  

Bonus Skills
  
Experience in DevOps, CI/CD, observability, telemetry, or distributed scheduling systems.
  
Startup / CTO / Architect experience highly valued.
  
  

Why Join Us
  
Build a full automation product from scratch — your architecture becomes the company’s foundation.
  
**Work in one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech areas:** Data Center Automation & Whitebox Networking.
  
Very high autonomy & direct collaboration with the founder.
  
Remote-friendly work environment.
  
Competitive salary + performance bonus + equity options.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
***hackajob** 
 is collaborating with
 **Board Intelligence** 
 to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.*
 Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.
   

  

 Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.
   

  

 We work with over 70,000 leaders and 3,000 organisations across the world, with clients across the Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and OMX 30. In 2024 we received substantial backing from K1 Investment Management - the leading B2B Enterprise SaaS investors. We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we’re looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.
   

  

 As we grow, we’re fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.
   

  

 The team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you’ll find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, philanthropic activities and lunch & learns.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.
   

  

**Our Engineering Team**
 Our Engineering team builds, maintains, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.
   

  

 This role is an on-site position based in our Central Stockholm office.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Board Intelligence in Stockholm, you’ll bring energy, proactivity, and a passion for staying ahead of AI-driven developments in the DevOps space. With expertise in Google Cloud and AWS, coupled with strong Terraform skills, you’ll play a pivotal role in building and automating scalable cloud infrastructure across multiple sites and providers worldwide. .
   

  

**What will you be responsible for?**
* Architect and deploy robust, multi-cloud systems across Google Cloud and AWS, ensuring scalability, reliability, and top-tier performance
* Take ownership of moving on-premise systems to the cloud, automating workflows, and fine-tuning hybrid setups for clients who need to stay partially on-prem
* Manage Kubernetes clusters, ensuring streamlined operations through provider-managed services while constantly improving efficiency and reliability
* Lead critical upgrades, patching, and cleanouts to de-risk legacy infrastructure and strengthen the business’s tech foundation
* Build infrastructure solutions that scale with the company’s rapid growth into new markets, integrating and automating diverse tech stacks acquired through acquisitions
* Establish best practices for CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and system performance monitoring, ensuring teams are equipped for high growth
* Work with engineering, product, and IT teams to align infrastructure goals with business needs, driving innovation and seamless integration.
* Keep up with AI-driven developments and emerging DevOps tools, ensuring the company stays on the cutting edge of technology.


**Requirements**
 We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.
   

  

**Role**
 We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:
   

  

* Extensive experience designing and managing scalable, multi-cloud environments across Google Cloud and AWS, with advanced expertise in Terraform for infrastructure as code.
* Proven track record of leading cloud migration projects, including on-prem-to-cloud transitions, hybrid solutions, and automating infrastructure for scalability across multiple sites and providers worldwide.
* Deep expertise in Kubernetes, including optimizing and managing containerized workloads through providers at scale.
* Demonstrated ability to handle complex tech debt, driving critical upgrades, patching, and risk mitigation with a business-focused approach.
* Proactive, hands-on problem solver with senior-level experience in identifying, diagnosing, and resolving infrastructure challenges independently.
* Strong understanding of modern DevOps practices, including automation, optimization, and scalability for high-growth, acquisitive organizations with diverse tech stacks.

 Vi tror att du kommer att trivas hos oss om du gillar att arbeta i en tekniskt avancerad och samarbetsdriven miljö, där innovation, säkerhet, automation och du som medarbetare står i fokus. Här får du inte bara möjlighet att fördjupa dig inom ditt område – vare sig det är IT-säkerhet, DevOps, systemutveckling eller infrastruktur – utan också att dela din kunskap och inspireras av andra.
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Software Engineer – Reverse Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Visa’s Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce.   We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people.   While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  





 The Opportunity
   

  





 We are looking for talented, curious, and energetic Software Engineers who embrace solving complex challenges on a global scale.  As a Visa Software Engineer, you will be an integral part of a cross-functional development team inventing, designing, building, and testing software products that reach a truly global customer base. While building components of cutting-edge payment technology, you will get to see your efforts shaping the digital future of monetary transactions.
   

  





 The Work itself
   

  




* Design code and systems that touch 40% of the world population while influencing Visa’s internal standards for scalability, security, and reusability
* Collaborate cross-functionally to create design artifacts and develop best-in-class software solutions for multiple Visa technical offerings
* Actively contribute to product quality improvements, value added service technology, and new business flows in diverse agile squads
* Develop robust and scalable products intended for a myriad of customers including end-user merchants, b2b, and business to government solutions
* Leverage innovative technologies to build the next generation of Payment Services, Transaction Platforms, Real-Time Payments, and Buy Now Pay Later Technology
* Opportunities to make a difference on a global or local scale through mentorship and continued learning opportunities



 Specific Requirements
   

  




* Maintain and troubleshoot iOS-based RE connections, primarily in jailbroken environments.
* Use and enhance internal RE toolkit and external tools (e.g., palera1n for jailbreaks, frida for bypassing security, Charles Proxy for traffic analysis).
* Reverse engineer iOS apps using interactive disassemblers (HexRays IDA, Ghidra, Hopper), injector tools (frida.re), and traffic proxies (Charles Proxy, Wireshark).
* Collaborate cross-functionally to document knowledge and improve workflows.
* Proactively detect, diagnose, and resolve disruptions in RE connections, often under time pressure and with limited documentation.
* Contribute to compliance with internal audits and security standards.



 Essential Functions
   

  




* Works alongside others to implement modifications to existing software code that complies with design specifications and meets security best practices.
* Assists with improvements to systems and tools and supports development and implementation of new automation, asking questions as necessary.
* Engages with team members and manager during code/design reviews, participates in on-call rotations and incident responses throughout product development and operations cycles.
* Leverages working knowledge of systems/platforms and telemetry analyses to identify basic issues in code, processes, and designs when they are inconsistent with customer/business objectives.
* Leverage expertise in iOS reverse engineering and telemetry analysis to identify and resolve issues in code, processes, and designs.
* Mentor and support less experienced engineers, contributing to a culture of learning and operational excellence.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  




* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field, OR Bachelor’s degree in a related field and directly related experience.



 Preferred Qualifications
   

  




* Knowledge of and ability to develop back-end (e.g. Python, Java, C++, PHP) code in support of package and product development. This includes the extension of capabilities of packages and products.
* The ability to develop and utilize Application Program Interfaces (APIs), a set of routines, protocols, and tools for building software applications that specify how software components should interact and are used when programming graphical user interface (GUI) components. An API may be for a web-based system, operating system, database system, computer hardware, or software library.
* Knowledge of and the ability to use database software (e.g., applications, web-based applications, information systems) to maintain, modify, and output data.
* Knowledge of systems integration process in which separately produced components or subsystems are combined and problems in their interactions are addressed.
* Knowledge of data structures, which consist of data organization, management, and storage formats that enable efficient access and modifications. This includes a collection of data values, the relationships among them, and the functions or operations that can be applied to the data.



  

  

 The Skills You Bring
   

  




* Energy and Experience: A growth mindset, curiosity, and passion for reverse engineering and security.
* Challenge the Status Quo: Comfort in “hacking” beyond traditional solutions, especially in undocumented or rapidly changing environments.
* Technical Expertise: Proven experience with iOS reverse engineering, jailbroken devices, and tools such as HexRays IDA, Ghidra, Hopper, frida.re, Charles Proxy, and Wireshark.
* Programming: Strong skills in Java, Swift, Objective-C, and experience with AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, and Datadog.
* Builder: Experience building and deploying modern services, with a focus on quality, scalability, and operational resilience.
* Learner: Constant drive to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving technical and regulatory landscapes.
* Partnership: Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Product, Test, DevOps, and Agile/Scrum teams.
* Communication: Strong documentation, mentoring, and communication skills.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Application Engineer HR till Axfood IT, Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med drygt 350 medarbetare. Det är vi som ser till att Axfood, och alla våra kedjor, kan ligga i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling. Vi jobbar med att utveckla och förbättra allt ifrån e-handel till logistiklösningar och AI.
   

  

 Hos Axfood IT blir du del av ett sammanhang som utmanar och levererar lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder. Här finns det alltid möjlighet att lära sig om ny teknik och växa, både som individ och tillsammans med kollegorna.
   

  

**Ditt nya team**
 I rollen tar du plats på avdelningen IT HR, som består av två agila team som tillsammans jobbar för att skapa värde för verksamheten genom moderna och stabila HR-system. SAP SuccessFactors är det centrala HR-systemet, kompletterat med flera andra lösningar som stödjer HR-processer för hela koncernen. I teamet finns både generalister och tekniska specialister som jobbar för att deras system ska leverera maximal effekt i vår verksamhet. Här finns ett nära samarbete med HR-verksamheten för att skapa de bästa lösningarna.
   

  

**Ett ax-plock – Kollegornas favoriter på jobbet**
* Möjlighet att påverka framtidens HR-lösningar i hela koncernen.
* Ett varmt och kompetent team med stark samarbetskultur.


**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Applikation Engineer blir du en nyckelperson i att utveckla, stödja och optimera Axfoods HR-processer genom smarta och hållbara IT-lösningar inom dina specialistområden. Du arbetar nära både HR och IT och får en central roll i att säkerställa att våra system, inom bland annat lön och resa, fungerar smidigt och effektivt.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**
* Vara med från kravställning till leverans – driva utvecklingsärenden och projekt i nära samarbete med HR och IT.
* Planera, prioritera och genomföra utvecklings- och förvaltningsaktiviteter för våra HR-system.
* Identifiera förbättringar och hitta innovativa lösningar som stöttar verksamheten på bästa sätt.
* Fungera som teknisk expert inom HR-systemområdet.
* Felsöka, analysera och konfigurera system och integrationer, samt säkerställa en hög kvalitet i drift och funktionalitet.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation för konfigurationer och processer.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad på systemens utveckling och föreslå relevanta förbättringar.
* Delta aktivt i våra agila sprintar och ceremonier – planering, stand-ups och retrospektiv.
* Säkerställa säkerhet, rutiner och god förvaltningsbarhet.
* Optimera licensanvändning, koordinera behörigheter och följa upp kostnader kopplade till utveckling.


**Din nya chef har ordet**
 "Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, engagerad och trivs i gränslandet mellan HR och IT. Du kommer att ha en viktig roll i att utveckla våra HR-system och bidra till att skapa en modern och hållbar arbetsplats." – Nina Bjore, Tech Product Area Manager
   

  

**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 För att trivas i rollen behöver du trivas i gränslandet mellan HR och IT. Du behöver också ha teknisk erfarenhet av HR-system, gärna SAP SuccessFactors och SD Worx.
   

  

**Vi tror att det är viktigt att du:**
* Har erfarenhet av förvaltning och utveckling av HR-system.
* Har erfarenhet av integrationer och ser säkerhet som en självklar del av ditt arbete.
* Har god förståelse för HR-processer.
* Har arbetat med agila metoder och verktyg som Jira.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Som person tror vi att du är lösningsoritenterad, nyfiken och engagerad, och trivs i att lösa problem. I den här rollen är tvärfunktionells samarbete viktigt och vi tror därför att detta är något du trivs bra i.
   

  

**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedIn-profil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester, intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll och ID-kontroll. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod, men vi kommer be dig styrka din identitet i processens slutskede.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekrytering på Axfood, kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.
   

  

 Lyssna på en pod om att jobba på Axfood IT, på Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/37BDOFjcKLkdyleKXLEKXZ?si=UVhPBFC4T96dy-tHa9uuDw

title: Konsult Microsoft Dynamics 365
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Konsult Dynamics 365**
**Om rollen**
 Accelerera din karriär och bli nästa generations konsult inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 för Finance och Supply Chain (AX) & Microsoft Dynamics Customer Engagement (CRM)! Som konsult hos Sogeti kommer du att stötta några av de största, mest älskade varumärkena i Europa på deras digitala transformationsresa.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Att arbeta med Microsoft Dynamics, antingen som konsult, superanvändare, processägare eller i samband med implementeringsprojekt.
* Att briljera i rollen som konsult och stötta kunder på deras digitala transformationsresa.
* Att använda din erfarenhet av processkunskap inom finance eller manufacturing för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar.
* Att bidra till utveckling och implementering av ERP/CRM-system.


**Din profil**
* 2-3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av processkunskap inom finance eller manufacturing.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Dynamics eller annan ERP/CRM-plattform, antingen som konsult, superanvändare, processägare eller i liknande roll.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i samband med en ERP/CRM-implementering.
* Pratar och skriver svenska obehindrat.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


**Ansökan**
*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag, urval sker löpande! Hoppas vi ses! Vill du veta mer? Kontakta TA Partner Marta Sundell så berättar hon gärna mer.*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Senior Data Scientist** 




 About Eghed
 


* Eghed is a knowledge hub, passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.



  





 About the Role
 


* We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who shares our passion for creating something new and has the courage to explore uncharted territories. Here at Eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.



  





 Your Responsibilities May Include
 


* Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



 We Believe That You
 


* Have at least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably with a consulting background.
* A university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Software Development, Engineering, or Economics).
* Proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts.
* Strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
* Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.



 Why Eghed?
 


* At Eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.



  





 Application
 


* Does this sound like something for you? Send your application and CV to info@eghed.se as soon as possible. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: Information Architect
description:
**I** 
**nformationsarkitekter till B3** 
**Visab Consulting**
 Hos B3 Visab Consulting stödjer vi finansindustrins utveckling i den digitala ekonomin. Vi söker nu fler engagerade informationsarkitekter som vill vara med och bidra till en samhällskritisk bransch. Med över 40 års erfarenhet har vi byggt långsiktiga relationer med ledande aktörer inom bank och försäkring, och vår expertis gör oss även till en attraktiv partner för snabbväxande företag.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
 Som informationsarkitekt hos oss får du arbeta i varierande uppdrag där du hjälper kunder att utveckla och implementera robust informationsarkitektur. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Skapa riktlinjer och standarder för informationsarkitekturens struktur.
* Sätta upp processer för att hantera och vidareutveckla informationsflöden.
* Säkerställa att rätt information når rätt personer vid rätt tidpunkt.
* Arbeta med datalagring, tillgänglighet och säkerhet för att förhindra obehörig åtkomst och dataförluster.


 Vi tror att framgång bygger på samarbete och kunskapsdelning och vi ser gärna att du är en lagspelare som uppskattar att arbeta prestigelöst och flexibelt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som informationsarkitekt eller enterprisearkitekt, med fokus på informationsstruktur.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från bank- eller försäkringssektorn.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Certifieringar inom relevanta områden är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet som verksamhetsarkitekt.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv och flexibel lönemodell.
* Möjlighet att påverka dina arbetstider och arbetsplats.
* Tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar för din professionella utveckling.
* En stark wellness-satsning genom Team B3, som främjar både hälsa och arbetsglädje.


**Varför B3** 
 Visab? Vi är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: kraften från ett stort bolag och den personliga samhörigheten från ett mindre. Vi är stolta över att ha blivit erkända som "Årets Karriärföretag" och av "Great Place to Work". Våra medarbetare pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetsmiljön där olikheter välkomnas, och stoltheten över att bidra till både kunders framgång och samhället i stort. Vi samarbetar med initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad.
   

  

**Kontakt** 
 :
   

  

 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Ansök nu! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Lidia Hagos (lidia.hagos@b3.se) eller konsultchef Hanna Skoog (+4670-260 12 65).

title: Regional Sales Representative, Northern Europe
description:
**Your Title:** 
 Regional Sales Representative, Northern Europe
   

  

**Job Location:** 
 Sweden - Danderyd or Remote in Sweden, Norway, Finland
   

  

**Division:** 
 Civil Construction Field Solutions CCFS
   

  

*Are you looking to be a part of an award-winning organization and one of the fastest growing technology companies that is transforming the construction landscape with innovative technology solutions?*
*Join our team! We will offer your versatile tasks in a diverse, inspiring and dynamic working environment with great colleagues. Apply as soon as possible! Please, submit your CV/application only in English.*
 In this position you will have a very specific focus on CEC Machine control solutions and Connected Site promotion with a primary focus on Northern Europe. You will be deeply involved in developing solid business relationships with Equipment Dealers.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will provide sales and application support for distributors and potentially end users in the CEC product portfolio You will:
   

  

* Increase market share through the development of Connected Site solutions to existing accounts and new customers. You will also be able to develop customer interest on Trimble Continuum solutions to develop sales on the entire CEC solutions
* Sell through select and perhaps multiple channels of distribution and have large project involvement, and will develop strategic key end-user relationships to ensure the successful sale of all Trimble products and services. You will have a strong field presence across the Nordic region
* Be responsible for ongoing dealer development through the introduction, follow-up and ongoing involvement in Trimble’s channel development programs/workshops.


**Primary Responsibilities**
 You will report to the Nordic Regional Sales Manager. Together with the Regional Sales Manager, you will participate in the development and implementation of regionally assigned sales plans. You will be in interface with distributor management, operations, sales, service and support staff.
   

  

**You Will**
* Develop strong long term business development with regional equipment dealers and implementation of Trimble Technology Outlets
* Conduct on site distributor training and job site demonstrations together with the application engineers
* Be in interface with major regional accounts
* Conduct joint sales presentations with focus on Educational Presentations
* Drive the Annual Review Meetings with key accounts in each dealer territory
* Assist in the identification, procurement and subsequent training of distribution sales and application personnel
* Evaluate marketplace potential for all served markets and customer segments using Data Analytics services as available
* Assist in the development of and participation in, specific technical communications and training requirements such as Trimble Dimensions, Boot Camps, Construction News, and others
* Ensure new product release involvement by all dealers including local strategy, training and proper inventory
* Provide input on competitive products and activities primarily to the CCFS Business Area
* Assist in the identification and development of new distribution.


**What Skills, Experience And Knowledge You Should Bring**
* Proven experience of successful consultative sales
* Experience in Channel development and management
* Business, sales, market and domain knowledge in survey, civil engineering and / or construction
* Ideally experienced in Technology solutions for Construction
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability and willingness to travel up to+/- 50%
* Proficient knowledge of civil construction applications
* Product knowledge is a bonus
* Strong collaboration and relationship building skills
* Ability to prioritize, organize and manage multiple projects at one time
* Fluency in English and one Scandinavian language. Additional Nordic language skills are a bonus.


**About Our CCFS Division**
 Trimble's Civil Construction Field Solutions division focuses on providing advanced technology solutions to enhance productivity, accuracy, and efficiency in civil construction projects. This division integrates hardware and software tools to support the entire construction lifecycle, from initial site assessment and planning through to design, construction, and ongoing maintenance.
   

  

 Key offerings include machine control systems, site positioning systems, and software for project management and collaboration. These tools enable precise grading, excavation, paving, and site management, which help contractors and engineers streamline workflows, reduce rework, and improve overall project outcomes. For more information on currently developed products, see https://heavyindustry.trimble.com
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: https://www.trimble.com/en
   

  

**Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment**
 We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
   

  

 We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
   

  

**Trimble’s Privacy Policy**
****How to Apply:****
 Please submit an online application for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply Now’ button located in this posting.
   

  

****Posting Date****
 09/26/2025
   

  

****Application Deadline:****
 Applications could be accepted until at least 30 days from the posting date.
   

  

****Join a Values-Driven Team: Belong, Grow, Innovate.****
 At Trimble, our core values of Belong, Grow, and Innovate aren't just words—they're the foundation of our culture. We foster an environment where you are seen, heard, and valued (Belong); where you have an opportunity to build a career and drive our collective growth (Grow); and where your innovative ideas shape the future (Innovate). We believe in empowering local teams to create impactful strategies, ensuring our global vision resonates with every individual. Become part of a team where your contributions truly matter.
   

  

 Trimble’s Privacy Policy
   

  

 If you need assistance or would like to request an accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact AskPX@px.trimble.com.

title: Revenue Accountant
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

  

  

**The role of a Revenue Accountant at Canonical:**
 If you are passionate about the technology industry and want to work for a company that aligns with your interests, we might be the place for you! Canonical, and our world class Ubuntu product, attracts some of the leading talent from around the world. Come and work with exceptional people and advance your career in Finance!
   

  

 Our Finance team is growing and it's a really exciting time to join the team. We are looking for bright, motivated people who have a passion for making a difference. You will be seeking an opportunity to drive process improvements and change, input your ideas and truly contribute to a highly productive team.
   

  

 We are looking for an exceptional Accountant with IFRS 15 experience to help us ready the business for public market scrutiny through our planned IPO. The right candidate will have domain expertise and a passion for IFRS 15 or ASC 606.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role may be office based in London, or Remote in EMEA Time Zones.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Assist in the month end reporting process to deliver timely and accurate information
* Have full responsibility for a part of the revenue recognition process relevant to your strengths
* Assist with the year end audit process and statutory reporting
* Support the finance team's wider plans to prepare for an IPO
* Improve the efficiency of financial processes and procedures and monitor compliance
* Share knowledge between team members to ensure cover is available when needed
* Actively develop your own skills to ensure current knowledge of applicable standards and regulations
* Establish strong relationships with key colleagues outside the wider finance team


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record and subsequent career performance
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent
* Qualified accountant (ACCA, ACA, ACMA, CPA, etc.)
* IFRS 15/ASC 606 revenue recognition experience
* Experience at a large public accounting firm, or public multinational corporate accounting department preferred
* NetSuite or similar systems experience a plus
* Willingness to travel up to four times per year


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Junior design engineer – CAD
description:
**Where:** AgriClima, Helsingborg, Sweden
  
**Contract Type:** 1-year, Full time
  
**Level:** Junior
  
**Express your interest until:** 10.12.2025
  
WE ARE
  
AgriClima Consulting AB is an advisory company that offers high-standard services within an environment of international cooperation. AgC specializes in several areas, including climate change mitigation, LCA/LCC, environmental protection, blockchain analysis, and defense technologies. We work on EU-funded projects with international partners. Although we are based in Sweden, we operate in Asia, Africa, and Europe. Our client base consists of both national and international organizations, as well as European agencies
  
  

WE LOOK FOR
  
AgriClima Consulting AB is looking for a junior design engineer with deep practical knowledge of 2D-CAD and basic knowledge of 3D-CAD.
  
In this role, you will be working with prototyping, creating and finalizing detailed 2D-CAD models and mechanical drawings for AgriClima projects.
  
We are looking for someone who has a true passion for design engineering rather than mechanical. You should enjoy working with complex design solutions and be dedicated to tackling technical challenges.
  
To excel in this position, you should have an eye for detail and a strong commitment to approaching challenges with enthusiasm and precision.
  
The ideal candidate should possess the following skills and experience:
  
* A basic degree in engineering with 2D-CAD design as a component, and min. 2 years of practical experience in 2D-CAD design


or
  
A high school diploma or equivalent with 8 years of experience in 2D-CAD
  
* Proficiency in AutoCAD software is mandatory
* Experience in 3D-CAD design is an added value
* ANSIS experience and additional drafting coursework is considered a plus
* Familiarity with full product development cycles
* Fluent in Swedish and English. Basic knowledge of another language is an added value
* The role demands strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to collaborate with a team of experts in several countries.
* Performing any other activities as requested by AgC.


HOW TO EXPRESS YOUR INTEREST?
  
1. You should send a Letter of Motivation oriented towards the position and detailing your experience
  
2. A CV
  
3. Contact details of 3 references not related with you
  
**4. Submit to:** info@agriclima.eu indicating in the subject line “CAD01/2025/Design Engineer” in the subject.
  
5. The language of the documents must be English.

title: Territory Sales Manager - Software Monetization – Nordics
description:
Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.
   

  

 "As market leader within Digital Identity and Security, Thales makes personal digital interaction simple and secure in an increasingly connected society. From secure software to biometrics and encryption, Thales provides technologies and services that enables business and governments to authenticate identities and protect data, enabling its clients to offer trusted digital services to billions of individuals. Located in Älvsjö since 2012, the site houses both a commercial office as well as two productions within Identity & Biometric Solutions, and Banking & Payment Services. Working commercially across all business areas within Digital Identity and Security, Thales has become a trusted partner within various businesses as well as governments throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Title:** 
 Territory Sales Manager - Software Monetization – Nordics
   

  

**Base location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid model).
   

  

**The position requires that you undergo and be approved in accordance with the applicable regulations for security protection. For positions where Thales has requirements for security clearance, this may entail a requirement for Swedish citizenship.**
**Role Overview:**
**This is a predominantly a net-net, new business hunter role.**
 As the Territory Sales Manager for the Thales Software Monetization portfolio in the Nordic region, you will be the primary point of contact for all interested parties, guiding them from the initial inquiry through to contract conclusion. Your responsibilities will include actively identifying, qualifying, and engaging with potential new customers, with a particular focus on larger enterprises. Leveraging your professionalism and experience in sales, you will play a crucial role in inspiring potential clients about our innovative Sentinel solutions.
   

  

 As a valued member of the sales team, you will contribute to our collective success and drive growth in the region.
   

  

**Details:**
 The position is based in the Thales Software Monetization division:
   

  

 Thales has more than 30 years of experience in software protection, software delivery and license management with many thousands of customers worldwide. Software companies and smart device manufacturers can use these solutions to reliably license, deliver and protect their software, enabling steady business growth. The Sentinel product portfolio helps customers get the most value from their software whether it is on-premise, in the cloud or on an embedded device. Sentinel is the leading brand name in the software industry for secure, flexible and future-proof software monetization solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Actively acquire new customers across various industry segments while developing a robust opportunity pipeline.
* Generate new contacts and engage with potential B2B clients through field visits, phone calls, and online outreach.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for interested parties, guiding them from initial inquiry through to contract conclusion.
* Conduct direct sales of our products, solutions, and services, focusing on key accounts and the upper midmarket sector.
* Perform in-depth market analysis to identify promising key customers within your segment, while participating in marketing initiatives, trade conferences, and industry events.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams, orchestrating efforts across pre-sales, product management, and professional services to drive customer success.
* Develop compelling project benefits and value propositions tailored to meet the needs of both customers and prospects.
* Create forecasts and measurable plans aimed at achieving your sales targets.
* Ensure accurate and thorough documentation of all activities in our CRM system, Salesforce, to maintain traceability and facilitate effective management of customer interactions.


**About you:**
 You are a naturally curious individual with a strong customer-centric mindset, always looking to understand and meet the needs of clients. Your exceptional communication skills enable you to engage and connect with people, demonstrating agility and adaptability in various situations. You thrive in both independent and team-oriented environments, consistently showcasing a structured and organized approach to your work. You are motivated and dynamic, bringing enthusiasm to your interactions and inspiring others around you. Your diverse background and experiences enrich our culture, and you value collaboration as a key to innovation. If you are excited about technology and eager to contribute to a global organization, we want to hear from you and see how you can be part of our journey.
   

  

**Expected Skills:**
* At least 5 years of experience in Sales of Software/IT Solutions within a B2B environment; experience as a Sales Engineer or Consultant is advantageous.
* A consultative mindset coupled with comprehensive listening skills.
* Proficiency in understanding complex business processes and models of medium to large enterprises.
* Experience with sales methodologies such as Value-based Selling or Diagnostic Selling.
* A strategic thinker who can effectively apply skills to achieve goals related to quotas and KPIs.
* Exceptional communication skills (both spoken and written) with a passion for technology and creating value through innovative solutions.
* A motivated and dynamic individual, capable of energizing prospects.
* Willingness to travel.
* Native proficiency in either English or Swedish, with professional fluency in both; knowledge of Finnish or Norwegian is a plus.
* An independent yet team-oriented professional with a structured approach to work.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, IT-related fields, or a comparable qualification.
